newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Run on Hungary's Postabank continues at weekend.
newsitem.headline: Run on Hungary's Postabank continues at weekend.

text.p: Thousands of people queued on Saturday for a second day to withdraw money from Postabank, one of Hungary's largest banks, despite government assurances that it was sound.

"We have had so many disappointments that we cannot believe half of what the government says," one man queuing outside a Postabank office told Hungarian radio. "I'd rather keep my money under my pillow."

The bank, which has some four million listed deposits in branch offices throughout the country, including in post offices, was hit by a run that began on Friday after rumours circulated in Budapest that it had suffered big losses. Offices were opened for the weekend to accomodate customers.
The national news agency MTI and Hungarian newspapers said that some 10 billion forints had been withdrawn from the bank in one day.

But National Bank of Hungary president Gyorgy Suranyi said Postabank remained sound and added that he did not believe the run would have a ripple effect undermining the rest of the Hungarian banking industry.

"The majority of the money that is taken out of Postabank appears in the other banks, so from the standpoint of the whole system stability is not a question," Suranyi told Hungarian radio in an interview.
"In addition, Postabank has extremely significant liquidity reserves...and of course the National Bank can be at their disposal.
"So I believe that taking into consideration the size of the bank and the liquidity, it cannot create an insecurity question as to the total system."
Bank regulators have said Postabank has assets of some 70 billion forints ($400 million) which could be liquidated quickly to cover the withdrawals.
